intro: Pectocarya lateriflora var. nuttallii, commonly known as the Nuttall's pectocarya, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the family. It thrives in arid to semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
